reviewText: I am not going to individually review all SIX films. In my book this entire series is a 5. The acting and the stories are MAGICAL (pun intended). The 4 stars are for a total score that also takes into account the audio and video quality of the set. You get the first SIX films. The collection is from the 2 discs sets released on DVD. The Ultimate editions (which are extended cuts) are not here. You also get all the bonus features from the original 2 disc sets, but in a strip down and more direct format. What should be noted is that the last film in this set is delivered to you exactly as released on the standard DVD/BD 2 disc release. All in all you get 7 discs.NOW FOR MY BLU RAY THOUGHTS: While these films are the best they have looked on home theatre it should be noted that the picture is average at best. The audio however is not. The mix provided on these discs is below average. What is noteworthy is that the video quality progresses after each film. By the third film Prisoner of Azkaban the picture becomes much better. The best disc in the set is the last Half Blood Prince. SPECIAL FEATURES: All carried over,albeit in a stripped down format (less the annoying interactive menus). FINAL VERDICT: A must upgrade for any Harry Potter fan.P.S. It should be duly noted that this will not be the last giftset you will see. There are 2 more Harry potter films to be released. I am certain that those will be included in a giftset as well, only to be followed by some Ultimate Edition giftset. So prepared to be milked.
summary: Harry Potter: Blu Ray 1-6 Giftset review!

reviewText: Harry Potter is certainly an entertaining fantasy series. Overall, the three main characters - Harry, Ron, and Hermione - are well cast and convey both the joy and seriousness of the wizarding world. I do take a star off for the fact that the movies often have huge plots holes and sometimes meander off into irrelevant sidetracks. It seems the directors and scriptwriters weren't quite sure how to transform the books into movies. For example, it never really becomes clear how and why Voldemort has gained so many followers. Is it a certain ideology? Is it because his followers want to kill muggles? It just seems that he's a two-dimensional "bad guy" with nothing better to do than be evil. That's something I think could have been explored more than, say, Harry's flirtations with Cho. Hopefully, there will be a extended versions of the movies like the Lord of the Rings extended versions that can fill in some of these plot holes and make the story richer. On the whole though, they're still fun to watch.
summary: A fun fantasy saga, but far from perfect

reviewText: I got this package of Potter movies during Black Friday Week at a killer price.  Although I saw all the films in Theaters, I never purchased any of them on DVD or Blu-Ray.  I couldn't resist the price so bought it.  All the films look FANTASTIC in blu-ray, and I really enjoy being able to turn on the subtitles so I can actually understand all of the dialogue, especially the Ron Weasley character who mumbles his way through these movies with a very heavy English accent.  I could never understand him while watching the films in theaters.  I have not watched any of the special features so I cannot comment on them.  I rarely watch special features.  If you have these films on DVD I'm sure it's worth the upgrade to blu-ray, especially if you can get this package on sale like I did.

reviewText: This review comes across as a *product* review - not a movie review.This hot little number is fan-tastic.  If you *DO NOT* own any of the previous 6 Harry Potter movies, then this is the product for you.  You get all 6 movies for the price of about $5-6/movie.  Packaging-wise you win big because they don't use traditional DVD containers (which measure about the width of your pinky finger).  Some may balk at the new packaging, others who already have a large DVD collection may savor the idea of having more space.  The DVDs come out rather easy with little to no effort exerted - and from my inspection it protects the DVD fairly well.  Also, the cardboard-composite DVD husk that holds all the DVDs together is fairly substantial.  It looks pretty good on my shelves - and it also makes it so darn easy to find!  (I have a few 100 DVDs).Be forewarned, you should check to make sure you have *all* discs in your collection.  I was missing one of mine, but Amazon's customer service was kick-ass and sent me a replacement no problemo.Each of the films basically is a wide-screen version of the movie.  There may be a few special features (e.g. trailers, deleted scenes?), but I haven't checked them out to confirm this.  This is a great product for someone who just wants to have the DVDs to watch the movies.  If you're looking for extras and the like, you're probably better holding off on your purchase and waiting for the Deathly Hallows Parts 1 & 2 to come out whereupon they will probably re-issue some sort of mega-DVD combo pack.
summary: GREAT if you don't own any of the previous movies

reviewText: If watching a geek earn his XP upgrades over a coarse of 7 movies, that run 2 hours longer then they should, appeals to you, then definitely pick this box set up. If terrible acting, stupid plots, overkill of CGI, magical disbelief and child written adventures aren't your thing, then avoid it all costs.I don't think there is a person on the planet who doesn't know what Harry Potter is, but I for one am sick and tired of it and wish this damn thing would come to an end already and people would grow up and watch decent movies to rave on about for a change.Harry Potter is 7 long & boring movies of a boy with repressed homosexual tendencies doing nothing but bragging he is the "chosen one" and waving his wand around like a fairy increasing his XP points for his Dungeons & Dragons battles.Slam me with unhelpful reviews, you know you will, but I speak my mind, and I know many others think the exact same thing about this garbage. The world has enough Vampire, Zombie, Wolf-man, Mythical Creatures and Supernatural movies already... and add Harry Potter to that list of movies that should be banned from being made for the next 10 years to make up for the hundreds that have been made in the last 15 years. Enough already.

reviewText: Like most here, my wife and I had seen all these Harry Potter movies in the theater. Since then my wife read the books and wanted to see the movies again. So I bought them for her as a gift. She was very happy to get them and we decided to watch them one a night for a week. So we settled in for a week of entertainment.You can't imagine how irritating it is to expect to see something you know happens - that never happens. I.e., it has been deleted! Scenes have been deleted from several of the movies in this set. It was a very irritating experience.This has happened before with DVDs I have purchased and it is extremely infuriating. Why do they do this? They should at least have the courtesy to tell you that scenes that were in the theatrical release are deleted from the DVDs. That way you at least know what you are getting and can decide to buy or not. By deleting scenes on the sly, I believe they are selling an inferior product and, that way, feel they are putting something over on us dump consumers.I cannot rate this set more than one star because I feel I have been cheated.
summary: I feel I have been cheated

reviewText: No need to repeat about the popularity of Harry Potter movies. However, from a practical point of view this set is a perfect way to save at least $15 on shipping. Instead of purchasing each movie separately and being charged shipping costs for each movie - six times in total, I paid the shipping costs only once for the whole set of 6 movies. Further, each DVD is factory sealed and shrink wrapped separately from each other - so if you already have some of Harry Potter movies in your collection - you don't have to keep the whole set. I already had Harry Potter years 1 & 2 in my collection, so I kept the years 3 to 6, and the first two movies gave to my 6-year-old nephew as a gift. He was very happy to have it!

reviewText: This set of six films(to date) of the Harry Potter series is a very good way of owning the set of basic films without having to pay the huge price tag for all those with the extras.This set has very little of them(just three of the trailers) and is basically the first disc of the two disc editions currently available elsewhere.Due out soon are the final movie installments of the final book;being put into two parts to reap the maximum benefits.And I'm sure in the future when all is said and done we will see not one but two and even three disc versions along with expanded editions of each movies,etc,along with the usual all inclusive set.Author JK Rowling created a bonanza of a book series/franchise with her Harry Potter coming-of-age creation.It submerges the reader/viewer into a fantastical world of wizards and witches;some good,some very bad.Each installment provides us with a glimpse of Harry growing up before our eyes as he attends each successive year the Hogwarts School of Witchcraft & Wizardry.With close friends Hermione and Ron we see the trio thrown into ever increasing dangerous events all leading up to a grand battle with the evil that killed Harry's parents,Tom Riddle/Lord Voldemort.The movies have made overnight stars of its' leading thesps,Daniel Radcliffe,Emma Watson and Rupert Grint.In the movies we come to understand what a house elf is,a phoenix,a basilisk,dementors,how to play Quidditch and we are introduced to such fascinating characters as Prof.Dumbledore,Sirius Black,Hagrid,the Weasley family,the Malfoys,Prof.Snape,and so many other just as important players.Some of the more well known actors to appear are Robbie Coltrane,Richard Harris,Richard Fiennes,Gary Oldman,Michael Gambon and Maggie Smith.The movies are well acted all around and the special effects to create the world and its' special feel are wonderful to behold.Of course the authors books contain a much better and more detailed storyline and I recommend a read through these volumes if the movies tweak your appetite at all for more.But the movies do do the best they can within their celluloid constraints in trying to bring to books to life.And if the box office receipts and overall take of Harry Potter merchandise worldwide is any indication the movies have done a great job of it.Each movie has been transferred wonderfully and all are in their respective widescreen ratios.Each single sided DVD comes in a narrow slip case which I found were nice and snug.A highly recommended set of all the Harry Potter movies to date for those who like their Harry Potter taste,without all the calories!
summary: Harry Potter Lite-all the taste without all the calories!
Title: N/A

reviewText: What can you say about a set of great movies which are then improved even more by putting them on Blu-ray and packaging all six together?  If you purchase the six individual Blu-ray movies, they currently run $105.94 as opposed to the $92.99 for this set.  So you not only get top-quality movies, but you save $13.00 in the process.  The picture quality and sound quality are superb.  As I said, there isn't much more to say about movies that have been reviewed hundreds of times.  As for an erroneous opinion that you are getting ripped off by this set, all I can say is do the math.  The 5-pack Blu-ray version sells here for $80.99, not $54.99 (that was the DVD 5-pack which is now down to $49.99), so the difference between the 5-pack and the 6-pack is only is only $12.00.  The Half Blood Prince sells individually for $19.49, so, you save $7.49 off the price of the sixth movie by buying this set.
